nodes.name: Split
nodes.description: This node splits the incoming DataFrame into 2. It takes in the fraction to use in splitting the data. For example, if the fraction is .7, it would split the data into 2 DataFrames, one containing 70% of the rows and the other containing the remaining 30%.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.name: fraction1
fields.title: Fraction 1
fields.description: Fraction to be used for Splitting the DataFrame into two. The first DataFrame would go to the lower edge output. The other would go to the higher edge output.

nodes.name: StickyNote

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
When splitting the edge with lower index gets the data in proportion to split percent specified.


The other edge gets the remaining percentage of data.
